name: Elephant
description: A massive, herbivorous mammal with thick, wrinkled skin and long, powerful tusks. Known for its strength and intelligence, the elephant uses its trunk for manipulation and communication.
memorable: Domineering presence on the battlefield with formidable tusks capable of inflicting serious damage.
goals: Typically travels in herds, can charge aggressively when threatened.
relations: Often found with other elephants in grasslands or jungles; may be used as war beasts by certain cultures.
environment: Grasslands and jungles where they travel in herds.
strengths: High strength allows for powerful melee attacks and ability to absorb damage.
weaknesses: Low dexterity leads to poor agility and vulnerability to quick opponents.
attacks: Capable of gore attacks with tusks inflicting piercing damage, and stomping on prone creatures for additional bludgeoning damage.
most_powerful_ability: Trampling Charge allows it to knock down opponents and follow up with stomping attacks.
senses: Has passive Perception of 10, allowing it to detect threats reasonably well.
additional_information: Can grapple creatures with its trunk for battlefield control.
Not very effective in social situations due to low Charisma.
Formidable at disrupting enemy formations with charges.
Uses tusks and a massive body as its primary weapons.
Typically peaceful but can be dangerous when threatened.
test_queries: huge creature that charges at enemies
herbivorous beast that travels in herds
intelligent creature with a trunk and tusks
